alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central DeKalb County through 615 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Henagar, or 11 miles northeast of Fort Payne, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Henagar, Valley Head, Hammondville, Mentone and Desoto State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
